title: AIT MIZO: Shared media archive with authentication, admin, folders, uploads, search, and link library

requirements.text: Implement authentication using Internet Identity and require login to access the app’s dashboard and all archive features.

quotes:
Login using **unique username** (primary identity)
* Admin panel to manage users
* Dashboard access after login
All registered users can view and access all uploaded content.

acceptanceCriteria: Unauthenticated users are redirected to a login screen.
Users can sign in/out using Internet Identity.
All main routes (Dashboard, Memory, Question Papers, Admin) are protected and inaccessible without authentication.

requirements.text: Add a unique-username system layered on top of Internet Identity: after first login, require the user to claim a globally unique username; store and display the username as the primary identity in the UI.

quotes: Login using **unique username** (primary identity)

acceptanceCriteria: On first login, the user must choose a username before accessing the dashboard.
Usernames are unique across all accounts; attempts to claim an existing username fail with a clear error message.
After claiming, the username is shown in the app header/profile area and used wherever a user label is displayed.

requirements.text: Create an Admin panel that allows designated admin users to manage users (list users, view details, grant/revoke admin role, and deactivate/reactivate accounts).

quotes: Admin panel to manage users

acceptanceCriteria: Only admin users can access the Admin panel route/UI.
Admin can list all registered users with username, principal, role (admin/non-admin), and status (active/deactivated).
Admin can change a user’s role and status, and changes take effect immediately for authorization and UI access.

requirements.text: Build the post-login Dashboard layout with two primary sections: (A) Memory Section and (B) Question Paper Section, with navigation optimized for both desktop and mobile.

quotes:
### 3. Dashboard Layout (After Login)

Create two main sections:

## A. MEMORY SECTION
## B. QUESTION PAPER SECTION

acceptanceCriteria: After login and username claim, the user lands on a dashboard that clearly presents Memory and Question Paper sections.
Navigation works on small screens (mobile) and large screens (desktop).
Each section has an entry point and dedicated pages for its tools (upload, folders, search/filter).

requirements.text: Implement the Memory Section content model and UI: support uploading photos, videos, and documents; bulk uploads; drag-and-drop uploads; preview before upload; upload progress display; automatic upload date; sorting (newest/oldest); search by filename/metadata; download; and copyable internal share link for each item.

quotes:
Upload photos (all sizes)
* Upload videos (all sizes)
* Upload text files (PDF, DOC, TXT, etc.)
* Bulk upload option

* Drag-and-drop upload
* Progress bar during upload
* Preview before upload
* Download option
* Copy shareable internal link

* Automatic upload date display
* Sort by date (newest/oldest)
* Search bar

acceptanceCriteria: Users can upload supported file types into the Memory section using drag-and-drop and file picker.
Bulk upload supports selecting multiple files and shows per-file progress and overall status.
Each uploaded item shows upload date/time and supports sorting newest/oldest.
Search returns matching items by filename and stored metadata.
Users can preview common types (images and videos inline; documents at least show filename/type and allow download).
Each item can be downloaded from the UI.
Each item has a “Copy link” action that copies an internal URL that opens the item detail view when visited by a logged-in user.

requirements.text: Implement folder management and categorization for Memory items: create folders, rename folders, delete folders (with clear behavior for contained items), move items between folders, and assign categories/labels that can be used for filtering.

quotes:
Folder Management:

* Create new folders
* Rename folders
* Delete folders
* Move files between folders
* Categorization system

acceptanceCriteria: Users can create, rename, and delete Memory folders from the UI.
Users can move one or multiple items to a selected folder.
Deleting a folder follows a defined UX (e.g., prevent delete if not empty or move items to a default folder) and is consistently enforced.
Items can be assigned one or more categories/labels and filtered by them in the Memory section.

requirements.text: Implement the Question Paper Section with two sub-sections: (1) Old Question Paper Images and (2) External Links & Sources, each with its own foldering, search, and categorization controls.

quotes:
Divide into two sub-sections:

### 1. Old Question Paper Images
### 2. External Links & Sources

acceptanceCriteria: Question Paper section landing page provides clear navigation to “Old Question Paper Images” and “External Links & Sources”.
Each sub-section is functional and separated in UI and data model (no mixing item types).

requirements.text: For Old Question Paper Images: support image uploads (including bulk), drag-and-drop, progress, upload date display, folders structured by subject/year, rename/delete folders, and search & filter by subject and year.

quotes:
* Upload images of question papers
* Bulk upload option
* Create folders by subject/year
* Rename folder
* Delete folder
* Date of upload display
* Search & filter by subject/year

acceptanceCriteria: Users can upload multiple question paper images in bulk with progress indicators.
Each image displays its upload date/time.
Users can create folders and associate them with subject and year metadata (or equivalent structure) and rename/delete those folders.
Search and filters allow narrowing results by subject and year (and combinations).

requirements.text: For External Links & Sources: allow adding links with title and description; organize links into folders; rename/delete folders; categorize links by subject/exam type; and provide a redirect/open-link action.

quotes:
* Add website links (redirect feature)
* Title + description field
* Create folders
* Rename/delete folders
* Categorize by subject/exam type

acceptanceCriteria: Users can create a link entry with URL, title, and description.
Links can be organized into folders that can be created/renamed/deleted.
Links support categorization fields for subject and exam type and can be filtered/searched accordingly.
Each link has an “Open” action that redirects/opens the external URL in a safe way (new tab on web).

requirements.text: Enforce the centralized shared archive rule: all registered (active) users can view and access all uploaded content across both sections; no private content controls are exposed.

quotes: All registered users can view and access all uploaded content.

No private accounts
* Centralized shared archive system

acceptanceCriteria: Any logged-in active user can browse, search, view, and download any uploaded file/link across the platform.
No UI or backend permissions exist for per-user private folders/items.
Deactivated users cannot access any content until reactivated.

requirements.text: Add storage usage indicator(s): show total archive storage used and optionally per-section usage; update after uploads/deletes and present in a clear, human-readable format.

quotes: * Storage usage indicator

acceptanceCriteria: UI displays total storage used with appropriate units (KB/MB/GB).
Usage updates after successful uploads and deletions without requiring a full page reload.

requirements.text: Implement large-upload handling suitable for the Internet Computer environment, including chunked upload support and resilience to transient failures (retry UX where reasonable).

quotes: File size handling for large uploads

acceptanceCriteria: Frontend can upload large files using chunked/resumable-style requests to the backend actor.
If an upload fails mid-way, the UI reports the failure and allows the user to retry.
Backend stores uploads in a way that supports chunk assembly and finalization with metadata.

requirements.text: Provide fast retrieval behavior within platform constraints: optimize listing, search, and item retrieval APIs; implement backend indexing for search over filenames/metadata/tags (Memory) and subject/year/exam-type (Question Papers).

quotes: Database indexing for search

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes query methods that support paginated listing and server-side filtering/search.
Search results are returned within reasonable time for typical archive sizes (avoid scanning everything on the frontend).

requirements.text: Add a backup & recovery workflow within platform constraints: provide an admin-only export of archive metadata (and link data) and a documented restore/import pathway suitable for controlled recovery.

quotes: Backup & recovery system

acceptanceCriteria: Admin can export metadata (users, folders, items metadata, link entries) in a structured format (e.g., JSON) from the UI.
There is an admin-only restore/import mechanism or a clearly defined restore procedure surfaced in the Admin panel UI.
Export/import actions are protected and provide success/failure feedback.

requirements.text: Implement a cohesive UI/UX design system matching the requested theme: professional formal + Gen Z modern, clean minimal layout, soft neutral (cream/white) background, deep blue or muted purple accents, smooth animations, card-based grid layout, and fully responsive behavior to function well on web and mobile-sized screens.

quotes:
Theme:

* Professionally formal + Gen Z modern
* Clean minimal layout
* Soft neutral background (cream/white)
* Accent color: deep blue or muted purple
* Smooth animations
* Card-based grid layout
* Responsive design (web + mobile)

acceptanceCriteria: All primary screens (Login/Onboarding, Dashboard, Memory, Question Papers, Admin) follow the same consistent typography, spacing, and color tokens.
Layout adapts cleanly to mobile widths (single-column where appropriate) and desktop widths (multi-column grids).
Cards are used for content items and folders; interactions include subtle hover/press/transition animations without hurting performance.

requirements.text: Add PWA support so the web app can be installed on mobile devices (home-screen install) and behaves like a mobile app where supported.

quotes: Create a fully functional **website + mobile app** named **“AIT MIZO”**.

acceptanceCriteria: App provides a valid web manifest with name “AIT MIZO” and icons, allowing installation on supported browsers.
Installed experience opens as a standalone app window and retains routing/navigation correctly.

requirements.text: Generate required static brand assets (logo and app icons) and render them in the UI (app header/login screen) and PWA manifest/favicon.

quotes: named **“AIT MIZO”**.

acceptanceCriteria: Generated logo and icon assets are committed under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced by the UI.
Favicon/app icons appear in the browser tab and PWA install prompt where supported.
Branding is consistent with the specified cream/white + deep blue/muted purple theme.

constraints: Backend must be implemented as a single Motoko actor (no multiple backend services).
Only Internet Identity is supported for authentication; implement username as an application-level unique handle mapped to the authenticated principal (not as a standalone credential).

Do not edit any files under frontend immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui (compose these components instead).
Do not use external databases or third-party storage/CDN services; implement storage and indexing within Internet Computer canister constraints.
nonGoals: Do not build social features (no feed, likes, comments, follows, DMs).
Do not implement private accounts, per-user privacy controls, or access control lists beyond admin/user and active/deactivated status.
Do not integrate third-party auth providers (Google/Facebook/GitHub/Auth0) or web3 wallets.
Do not implement real-time chat or WebSocket-based features.

required: Minimal modern wordmark logo reading “AIT MIZO” with academic + archive vibe, cream background, deep blue/muted purple accents (ait-mizo-logo.dim_1200x400.png)
App icon symbol (abstract archive/media + academic motif), flat vector style, deep blue/muted purple on cream (ait-mizo-icon.dim_512x512.png)
Favicon version of the app icon, simplified for small sizes (ait-mizo-favicon.dim_64x64.png)

goalsToAdd: Build a shared, login-protected media archive on the Internet Computer for memories and academic question papers with strong organization and search.
preferencesToAdd: Use English for all user-facing UI text.
Prefer a clean minimal UI with cream/white background and deep blue or muted purple accents, optimized for responsive web and mobile-like (PWA) use.
